quickstart.title: Getting off to a quick start
quickstart.textContent:
Do you need help getting started? See the Quick Start guide. 
For help with planning and sizing your storage environment, click the link to the IBM Spectrum Protect Plus Blueprints in the Quick Start guide.

vmware.textSearchForVMsAndFolders: Search for VMs, folders, and more

slapolicy.textTraditional: VMware, Hyper-V, Exchange, Office365, SQL, Oracle, DB2 and MongoDB
slapolicy.textCloudOffloadSourceSettingsWarning: Changing the Object Storage Copy Source, Copy Destination Type, or Target Copy Server options will perform a full BASE Copy during the next job run.
slapolicy.textWormRetentionDisabled: The selected object storage server utilizes WORM retention. Spectrum Protect Plus Copy retention options are now disabled.
slapolicy.textOffloadToCloudStorageHover: This option copies data that is accessed frequently to cloud or repository storage.
slapolicy.textExclusionWarning: Some selections are disabled due to your selected resources.
slapolicy.textSnapshotRetentionDanger: Retention by number of snapshots is no longer supported.
slapolicy.textReducingRententionWarningMessage: Reducing the retention of this policy will cause older versions of data to be expired. Continue?
slapolicy.textCreateSucceed: The SLA policy was successfully created.
slapolicy.textConfirmDelete: This action deletes SLA policy {0}. The associated backup instances will remain available for recovery until their expiration, as defined by SLA policy {0}. Continue?
slapolicy.textChangeSiteBackupTarget: A new base backup will occur if the Site associated with the SLA Policy is changed. Change the Site associated with the SLA Policy?
slapolicy.textConfirmDisablingVSnapReplication: Disabling Backup Storage Replication will automatically change the Copy Source to Backup Policy Destination. Changing the Object Storage Copy Source will perform a full BASE backup during the next job run. Do you want to continue?
slapolicy.textArchiveToCloudTapeHover: This option copies data that is accessed infrequently to tape or cloud archive storage.
slapolicy.textSLAOffloadFrequencyError: Copy frequency value must be higher than the backup frequency value.
slapolicy.textSLABackupFrequencyError: Backup frequency value must be lower than the copy frequency value.

storage.registrationUpdatedMsg: The storage provider was successfully updated.

storage.title: Attached Storage
storage.textAddNewDisks: Add New Disks to Backup Storage
storage.textAddNewDisksInfo: Select one or more unused disks to add to the storage pool
storage.addDisksToVsnapMessage: No unused disks are available to add to the storage pool
storage.textConfigureNetworksDescription: Configure a specific network interface controller to function as the backup or replication network.
storage.textConfigureNetworksDisabled: The current disk storage does not support the configuration of individual network interface controllers.
storage.textNetworksUpdated: Network configuration has been updated successfully
storage.textFollowSPPBlueprint: Be sure to adhere to vSnap hardware and memory requirements as described in IBM Spectrum Protect Plus Blueprints accessible from the IBM Spectrum Protect Plus Knowledge Center.
storage.textEncryptionOptionMessage: The Encryption setting can only be applied during vSnap initialization. This option is for informational purposes only.
storage.textChangeSite: A new base backup will occur if the Site associated with the vSnap server is changed. Change the Site associated with the vSnap server?
storage.textInitializeFilesystemBody: This installation of IBM Spectrum Protect Plus includes on-board storage that can serve as a backup target. Before the storage can be used, additional software components will be installed and storage will be initialized. To enable encryption of backup data on the on-board storage, initialize the storage with encryption enabled. Select an initialization method to continue.
storage.textConfirmDisableSyncWrites: Disabling synchronous writes can lead to data loss and silent corruption of backup data if the storage server experiences an abrupt shutdown or reboot during a backup job. Disabling this option is not recommended unless the storage server resides in a stable environment that is adequately secured against hardware/power failures. Are you sure you want to continue?

catalog.textDeleteResource: Are you sure you want to delete the backup catalog data associated with the resource {0}?

catalog.textTestDetails: Restore the catalog and suspend all scheduled jobs.
catalog.textRestoreWarning: Are you sure you want to overwrite the IBM Spectrum Protect Plus Catalog on this server?
catalog.textConfirmRestore: A Catalog restore will overwrite the IBM Spectrum Protect Plus Catalog on this server. IBM Spectrum Protect Plus will be stopped while the Catalog is being restored. The user interface will not be accessible. All IBM Spectrum Protect Plus snapshots created after the Catalog backup was run will be lost. Select a restore mode.

job.textPitEligibility: Some selections do not have log backup option enabled and will not be included in the restore, but you can prevent this behavior via selecting On-Demand: Snapshot. Are you sure you want to select On-Demand: Snapshot?
job.textPitEligibilityWithContinue: Some selections do not have log backup option enabled and will not be included in the restore. Are you sure you want to continue?
job.textExcludeSelectionsNoSnapshot: Some selections are greyed out due to no snapshot selection, they will be excluded from restore if you continue.

policyAssignments.textDesc: A wizard to allow multiple resource associations to SLA policy

tile1.title: Copy to Tape
tile1.body: Copy data to IBM Spectrum Protect server that stores the data on physical tape media or in a virtual tape library for long-term data retention.

tile2.title: Multi-partitioned IBM Db2 Databases
tile2.body: Protect and recover your multi-partitioned IBM Db2 environments across multiple hosts.

tile3.title: Redesigned Restore Wizard
tile3.body: Step through a simplified restore wizard to meet all your recovery and reuse needs.

tile4.title: Enhancements
tile4.item1: Interact with the interface in different languages.
tile4.item3: Protect new operating and database versions.
tile4.item4: Benefit from real-time inventory of virtual machines and applications.

tile5.title: Fixes
tile5.body: For a list of APARs addressed in this release, click here.

tile6.title: Feature Documents
tile6.body: Requirements, Flashes, Known Issues and More...

tile1.title: Kubernetes Containers
tile1.body: Container backup support to protect persistent volumes that are attached to containers in Kubernetes clusters.

tile2.title: VMware Cloud on AWS
tile2.body: Provide lifecycle management and data protection for your virtual machines in VMware Cloud on Amazon Web Services.

tile3.title: AWS Deep Archive Support
tile3.body: Copy data to Amazon Glacier Deep Archive, a new Amazon S3 storage class providing secure and durable object storage for long-term retention of data.

tile4.title: Enhancements
tile4.item1: Recover larger number of VMs faster with VMware Streaming restore.
tile4.item2: Provide better SQL security, automation and efficiency.
tile4.item3: Improved LDAP support with searchable groups and trees.
tile4.item4: vSnap Active Directory support and improvements including repair capability.

tile5.title: Fixes
tile5.body: For a list of APARs addressed in this release, click here.

tile6.title: Feature Documents

tile7.title: Office 365
